line_1: From being caress'd to be left in the lurch,
line_2: The tool of a party, in state or in church:

line_1: Of Kitty (aunt left in the lurch
line_2: By grave pretence to go to church)

line_1: A Steeple now is left in lurch,
line_2: And mourns departure of the Church,

line_1: Who dares to leave a woman in the lurch. —
line_2: Around the world to find the wretch I'd search,

line_1: So dreading to be left i' th' lurch,
line_2: I made a skip to top o' th' Church,
